results.title: Dust [Widescreen] (A)
results.creator_credit: Ivan Sen, Teresa-Jayne Hanlon, Autumn Films, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Special Broadcasting Service Corporation
results.brief_description: 2 cars arrive at a desolate cotton property. One car carries two feuding white teenagers Amy (Nathalie Roy) and Mick (Tristan Bancks)- the other 2 aboriginal youths Leroy (Clayton Munro) and Vance (Wayne Munro) and an elderly aboriginal woman called Ruby (Peta Binge). Under the fast moving clouds a storm is brewing, and when racism reaches a head and the dust storm finally erupts, the 5 find themselves confined in a car where they can no longer flee the tragedy of the past. Nominated for three AFI awards, Ivan Sen’s final film received a special commendation at the Clermonth Ferrand Short Film Festival.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivan Sen, Teresa-Jayne Hanlon, Autumn Films, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Special Broadcasting Service Corporation

results.title: Journey (A)
results.creator_credit: Ivan Sen and ABC-TV (Australia). Indigenous Program Unit
results.brief_description: A twelve year old boy leaves his isolated home town hitchhiking across a forever changing landscape. His travels cause him to relive fragments of the life left behind as he struggles to find rest in a journey that may never end.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivan Sen and ABC-TV (Australia). Indigenous Program Unit

results.title: After Mabo (A)
results.creator_credit: John Hughes, Debra Annear, Richard Frankland and Mirimbiak Nations Aboriginal Corporation
results.brief_description: Filmed over a ten-month period throughout Australia, this probing documentary examines the political controversy surrounding Native Title and the Australian Federal Governments proposed amendments to the Native Title Act, 1993. It follows the Indigenous representatives in their attempt to fight the amendments in the media, in the bush, and in the halls of Parliament House, Canberra. This video is ideally suited to students of history, politics and Aboriginal studies. NOTE: There are no discussion notes included with this title.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Hughes, Debra Annear, Richard Frankland and Mirimbiak Nations Aboriginal Corporation

results.title: No way to forget (A)
results.brief_description: Based on Richard Frankland’s experiences as a field officer during the Royal Commission into Aboriginal custody, this film follows the journey of Shane as he drives from Swan Hill to Melbourne after a day in the field. During the night, his experiences play on his mind and imagination. He will be haunted by what he has seen.

results.title: Round up (A)
results.creator_credit: Rima Tamou, Pauline Clague and Core Original Productions
results.brief_description: Two country boys, one white and the other aboriginal find themselves out of place in the hustle and bustle of the big city. What they learn on the journey that they embark upon through unfamiliar territory, is that they are not as different as they first thought.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rima Tamou, Pauline Clague and Core Original Productions

results.title: Fly Peewee fly (A)
results.creator_credit: Sally Riley, Adrienne Parr, SBS Independent and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A young Aboriginal boy, Robbie is in the midst of the conflict between his father and his grandmother. Robbie’s grandmother is white and wants to give Robbie every advantage, while Robbie’s aboriginal father is searching for his own identity and place. A warm story about fragile but meaningful family relationships.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sally Riley, Adrienne Parr, SBS Independent and Film Australia

results.title: Mungo lady (A)
results.creator_credit: Mari Bennett, Rachel Perkins and Blackfella Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
In 1960 the remains of an Aboriginal woman were exhumed at Lake Mungo, NSW by the white anthropologist/archaeologist, Alan Thorne. The woman had been cremated at least 25,000 years ago, providing the first evidence of this practice, and evidence for elaborate funerary customs by Aborigines in pre-historic times. The remains were exhibited around the world, before being returned to the Aborigines in 1990. This program takes a look at this incident from an Aboriginal perspective.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mari Bennett, Rachel Perkins and Blackfella Films

results.title: Quest for country (A)
results.creator_credit: Michael Riley, Rachel Perkins and Blackfella Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
This program expresses the spiritual and physical catharsis of an Aboriginal man from the urban environment. Michael Riley gives an insight into the indigenous view of white society and highlights the problems which non-Aboriginal people may have in understanding this attitude as well as the difficulties Aboriginal people may have in explaining it.

results.title: From the bush (A)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
Explores how Aboriginal rock and roll singers combine black and white aspects of their life to create music. Living in a desert, they team up with a “whitefella” band and they commence a tour with a difference.

results.title: Songlines: contemporary aboriginal music (A)
results.creator_credit: Richard Frankland, John Foss, Australian Contemporary Music Development Co (AUSMUSIC) and Golden Seahorse Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic music industry skills”.
Introduction to the Music Industry. Module 4.6. Contemporary Australian Aboriginal music has become an international presence in recent years. This program profiles artists who have taken their brand of indigenous music to the world: Yothu Yindi, Archie Roach and Tiddas. Traditional elements are incorporated into contemporary styles. This is not simply a matter of throwing in the odd didjeridu and clap stick, but rather the traditional cultural role of Aboriginal music as an educational medium is maintained and extended to cover new, important issues and themes.
